meanings.definition: Tzitzis: fringes or tassels worn by Jewish men as a reminder of the commandments
meanings.sent1: He proudly displayed his tzitzis, showing his commitment to following the rules.
meanings.sent2: Every morning, he carefully put on his tzitzis before starting his day.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy thought the tzitzis were toys to play with.
meanings.sent4: The tzitzis fluttered in the wind, a symbol of faith and tradition.
meanings.sent5: The bright blue tzitzis stood out against his dark clothing, drawing attention to his beliefs.

meanings.definition: Tzitzis: the knotted threads attached to the corners of a tallit (prayer shawl)
meanings.sent1: His tallit was beautifully adorned with intricate tzitzis at each corner.
meanings.sent2: During prayer, he held the tzitzis of his tallit as a sign of reverence.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten kept trying to unravel the tzitzis from the tallit.
meanings.sent4: As he prayed, the tzitzis seemed to dance with each movement, a sacred rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The golden threads of the tzitzis gleamed in the sunlight, a shimmering symbol of devotion.
